meta.title: Forensic Medicine Test (The Champion Batch Hyderabad) - 04-06-2025 - 2025-06-04

questions.text: An individual is accused of physically assaulting another person, resulting in the victim sustaining a broken mandible. The incident, witnessed by several bystanders, prompts immediate police intervention. What action Police can take against the accused individual?
A significant update to Indian criminal law was introduced in 2023, replacing the colonial-era Indian Penal Code (IPC) of 1860. What is the new name for the IPC under this reform?
Which of these is a grievous hurt?

options.label: B
options.text: Sever bodily pain for 10 days with inability to do even basic activities like taking bath

questions.correct_answer: A. Incised looking lacerated over forehead
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Incised looking lacerated over forehead

questions.text: Two people had a fight in the morning. Later that evening, one of them was found dead. The clothes of the other person had some blood stains, and after testing, it was found that the blood belonged to the person who died. This is what type of evidence?

options.label: D
options.text: The presence of blood on accused is indirect evidence, and the fact that it matches with victim is direct evidence

questions.text: Which condition among the listed below is least likely to be associated Postmortem caloricity?

options.label: A
options.text: Exposure to extreme heat leading to sunstroke

options.label: B
options.text: Fatal convulsions resulting from strychnine poisoning

options.label: D
options.text: Overdose of a central nervous system depressant, such as barbiturates

questions.correct_answer: D. Overdose of a central nervous system depressant, such as barbiturates
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Overdose of a central nervous system depressant, such as barbiturates

questions.text: Which of the following will be present in molecular death, but not somatic death?

options.label: B
options.text: Well-developed Rigor mortis and postmortem staining

options.label: C
options.text: Skeletal muscle responsiveness to thermal and electrical stimuli

options.label: D
options.text: Absence of circulatory and respiratory functions

questions.correct_answer: B. Well-developed Rigor mortis and postmortem staining
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Well developed Rigor mortis and postmortem staining

questions.text: In which condition is an underwater autopsy of the heart primarily indicated to confirm diagnosis?
A forensic expert needs to visualize lipid accumulation in a tissue sample. Which staining technique should be utilized to specifically stain fats?
Which of the following microscopic findings would most strongly support the diagnosis of an antemortem thrombus?

options.label: A
options.text: Homogeneous eosinophilic material with occasional neutrophils

options.label: B
options.text: Parallel layers of pale eosinophilic material alternating with RBC-rich bands

options.label: C
options.text: Clot with central necrosis and bacterial colonies

questions.correct_answer: B. Parallel layers of pale eosinophilic material alternating with RBC-rich bands
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Parallel layers of pale eosinophilic material alternating with RBC-rich bands

questions.text: Two friends were working together at a construction site. A hammer fell from one friend's hand and hit the other friend’s head. The X-ray revealed a fracture. What type of fracture is this?

A person is found dead in his home. He was living alone. Neighbours called the police when they experienced a foul smell from home. On autopsy, injuries were seen as shown below. Based on above context which statement is true?
All are features of Antemortem wounds except:

options.label: A
options.text: Margins of wound closely approximated with each other

options.label: B
options.text: Infiltration of tissues and increased serotonin

questions.correct_answer: A. Margins of wound closely approximated with each other
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Margins of wound closely approximated with each other

questions.text: Fish tailing is seen in
Which is a feature of bruise?

options.label: C
options.text: Absent in areas of body under pressure

options.label: D
options.text: Extravasation of blood into surrounding tissues occur

questions.correct_answer: D. Extravasation of blood into surrounding tissues occur
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Extravasation of blood into surrounding tissues occur

questions.text: Injury in the image is a?
Which of the following is true with respect to bomb blast injuries?

options.label: A
options.text: Marshal’s triad occurs in secondary blast injuries and consists of multiple small abrasions, bruises and fractures

options.label: B
options.text: Primary blast injuries occur due to high velocity wind and causes injuries to gas filled internal organs like ear, lungs and intestines

options.label: C
options.text: Primary blast injuries occur due to high pressure shock wave and does not cause external injuries

options.label: D
options.text: Victim can be thrown away in tertiary blast injuries due to high pressure shock wave

questions.correct_answer: C. Primary blast injuries occur due to high pressure shock wave and does not cause external injuries
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Primary blast injuries occur due to high pressure shock wave and does not cause external injuries

questions.text: Autopsy of a bombing victim reveals: Intestinal perforation Skull base fracture with underlying brain contusions Absence of external lacerations Carboxyhemoglobin level of 38% What is the least likely blast injury type present?

A forensic expert is describing the distinguishing features of gunshot wounds during an autopsy of a gunshot victim. Each type of gunshot wound has characteristic appearances, depending on the range and the point of entry. Which of the following is not a correct feature of a gunshot wound?

options.label: A
options.text: Entry wound is bevelled in the outer table of the skull

options.label: B
options.text: Abrasion collar is seen in entry wound

options.label: C
options.text: Harrison-Gilroy test can detect gunshot residue

options.label: D
options.text: Stellate shaped wound is seen in contact shot

questions.correct_answer: A. Entry wound is bevelled in the outer table of the skull
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Entry wound is bevelled in the outer table of the skull

questions.text: Which of the following is False about gun shot wound?

options.label: A
options.text: Entry wound is usually smaller than exit wound

options.label: B
options.text: Contact shot on skull in entry wound have everted margins

options.label: C
options.text: Grease collar is present at exit wound

options.label: D
options.text: Rarely Abrasion collar may be seen in exit wound

questions.correct_answer: C. Grease collar is present at exit wound
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Grease collar is present at exit wound.

questions.text: Which of the following is the most likely type of wound shown in the below Image?
Which of the following is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Gunshot residue (GSR) is typically found on the hands of the shooter after firing a weapon.

options.label: B
options.text: The GSR particles are primarily made up of heavy metals from the primer of the cartridge, which are ejected into the air during firing.

options.label: C
options.text: Gunshot residue (GSR) is unlikely to be found on the body of the victim killed by firearm at distant range

options.label: D
options.text: Dermal nitrate test is used to identify heavy metal component of GSR

questions.correct_answer: D. Dermal nitrate test is used to identify heavy metal component of GSR
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Dermal nitrate test is used to identify heavy metal component of GSR

questions.text: A 73-year-old man is found dead in his apartment. Autopsy reveals multiple neck bruises and abrasions as well as the finding shown in the image. Assuming that the death results from an asphyxia mechanism, what is the most likely manner of death?
A man is allegedly killed by his brother. In autopsy a finding similar to the one shown in this radiological picture is seen. What could be the most possible cause of death?
A 55-year-old male prisoner, sentenced to death, underwent execution by judicial hanging. What is the most likely cause of death in this case?
questions.correct_answer: C. Fracture of upper cervical vertebra
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Fracture of upper cervical vertebra

questions.text: Which of the following is true with respect to dribbling of saliva in hanging?

options.label: A
options.text: Dribbling of saliva occurs in antemortem hanging and on same side of ligature knot. It does not occur in ligature strangulation

options.label: B
options.text: Dribbling of saliva occurs in antemortem hanging and opposite to side of ligature knot. It does not occur in ligature strangulation

options.label: C
options.text: Dribbling of saliva occurs in both antemortem hanging and ligature strangulation, opposite to side of ligature knot.

options.label: D
options.text: Dribbling of saliva occurs in both antemortem hanging and ligature strangulation, on same side of ligature knot.

questions.correct_answer: B. Dribbling of saliva occurs in antemortem hanging and opposite to side of ligature knot. It does not occur in ligature strangulation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Dribbling of saliva occurs in antemortem hanging and opposite to side of ligature knot. It does not occur in ligature strangulation

questions.text: An adult male of about 40-year-old age was found dead on the floor in his room, in prone position. A Tiffin box with orange, rice along with half liquor bottle was also found beside him. No disturbance of any kind i.e. clothing, bedding, almirah or any articles was noticed on the spot by police. On Autopsy, the finding as shown in image below was seen. What is the likely manner of death?
What is the primary cause of Paltauf's haemorrhages in drowning?

options.label: A
options.text: Direct trauma to the lungs from water entry

options.label: B
options.text: Rupture of alveolar walls due to increased pressure during forced expirations

options.label: C
options.text: Inhalation of foreign particles leading to lung irritation

options.label: D
options.text: Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) due to water aspiration

questions.correct_answer: B. Rupture of alveolar walls due to increased pressure during forced expirations
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Rupture of alveolar walls due to increased pressure during forced expirations

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman is found in a lake. She was unconscious with an initial ECG showing ventricular fibrillation. Considering the circumstances of freshwater drowning, what is the most likely cause of her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Total asphyxia induced by the panic and struggle in water

options.label: B
options.text: Cold water shock leading to involuntary laryngeal spasm

options.label: C
options.text: Rapid fluid shifts causing blood thickening and clot formation

options.label: D
options.text: Hemodilution from absorbed freshwater, leading to an electrolyte imbalance

questions.correct_answer: D. Hemodilution from absorbed freshwater, leading to an electrolyte imbalance
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Hemodilution from absorbed freshwater, leading to an electrolyte imbalance

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about fresh water drowning:
False -ve hydrostatic test in live born fetus is for?
The Spalding sign, characterized by the overlapping of cranial bones in a fetus after intrauterine death, is primarily caused by:

options.label: A
options.text: Severe maternal hypertension leading to intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR)

options.label: B
options.text: Brain ischemia leading to intrauterine death

options.label: C
options.text: Shrinkage of the cerebrum after death, leading to loss of alignment and overriding of cranial bones

options.label: D
options.text: A genetic anomaly causing cranial bone malformation

questions.correct_answer: C. Shrinkage of the cerebrum after death, leading to loss of alignment and overriding of cranial bones
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Shrinkage of the cerebrum after death leading to loss of alignment and overriding of cranial bones.

questions.text: Frost bite is very common in:
Which of the following statements about frostbite is not true?

options.label: B
options.text: Formation of ice crystals within tissues

questions.text: Raygat's test, used to determine a specific characteristic of the lungs post-mortem, is based on which of the following?
questions.correct_answer: B. Specific gravity of the lung
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Specific gravity of the lung

questions.text: Why do leg cramps occur during physical exertion in heat?

options.label: A
options.text: Dehydration and electrolyte imbalances, particularly low sodium levels, disrupt normal muscle function, leading to cramps.

options.label: B
options.text: High body temperature causes blood vessels in the legs to constrict, reducing blood flow and resulting in muscle cramps.

options.label: C
options.text: Excessive sweating causes the accumulation of lactic acid in muscles, which triggers cramping.

options.label: D
options.text: Overuse of muscles in hot conditions leads to muscle fatigue, causing cramps due to insufficient oxygen supply.

questions.correct_answer: A. Dehydration and electrolyte imbalances, particularly low sodium levels, disrupt normal muscle function, leading to cramps.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Dehydration and electrolyte imbalances, particularly low sodium levels, disrupt normal muscle function, leading to cramps.

questions.text: True about the below image:

options.label: A
options.text: Heat stiffening due to ATP depletion

options.label: B
options.text: Protein coagulation due to heat stroke

options.label: C
options.text: Can be seen in both antemortem and postmortem burns

questions.correct_answer: C. Can be seen in both antemortem and postmortem burns
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Can be seen in both antemortem and postmortem burns

questions.text: A 42-year-old male construction worker is brought to the emergency department after collapsing at a worksite on a particularly hot afternoon. He appeared confused and irritable. His rectal temperature was recorded as 41.2°C (106.2°F). He is found to have rapid, shallow breathing. His pulse is 140 beats per minute, blood pressure is 85/50 mmHg, and respiratory rate is 30 breaths per minute. Which of the following is likely in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Patient is aware that he has a high body temperature

questions.text: A 27-year-old woman reports a sexual assault that occurred outdoors during heavy rain. She arrives at the emergency department 12 hours later, still wearing the same wet clothes. Which of the following is the most accurate about evidence collection from her clothing?

options.label: A
options.text: Wet clothing should be dried with heat before packaging to prevent bacterial degradation.

options.label: B
options.text: Wet clothing should be placed in airtight plastic bags to preserve moisture-sensitive evidence.

options.label: C
options.text: Wet clothing may still yield biological evidence but must be air-dried before packaging in paper bags.

options.label: D
options.text: Biological evidence cannot be recovered from wet clothing due to dilution and contamination.

questions.correct_answer: C. Wet clothing may still yield biological evidence but must be air-dried before packaging in paper bags.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Wet clothing may still yield biological evidence but must be air-dried before packaging in paper bags.

questions.text: Which of the following is true with respect to examination of a female victim of sexual assault?

options.label: A
options.text: Toluidine dye should be used to detect recent microinjuries on genitalia before taking the swab for sperm detection

options.label: B
options.text: History should not be taken from the victim if her age < 12 years

options.label: C
options.text: Radiological confirmation of age of victim should be done in every case of rape victim examination

options.label: D
options.text: Per speculum examination may not be needed in young victim if there is no history of penetration

questions.correct_answer: D. Per speculum examination may not be needed in young victim if there is no history of penetration
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Per speculum examination may not be needed in young victim if there is no history of penetration

questions.text: Which of the following scenarios would be most likely to result in heteropaternal superfetation?

options.label: A
options.text: A woman ovulates and conceives during two separate cycles, with one fertilization occurring after intercourse with a different partner in the second cycle

options.label: B
options.text: A woman ovulates once but is fertilized twice by sperm from the same partner during a prolonged sexual encounter

options.label: C
options.text: A woman has two eggs released from the same ovulatory cycle and are fertilized by sperms from two different partners

options.label: D
options.text: A woman has two fertilized eggs from the same ovulation cycle, from wo different partners, but one implantation is delayed as compared to other

questions.correct_answer: A. A woman ovulates and conceives during two separate cycles, with one fertilization occurring after intercourse with a different partner in the second cycle
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A woman ovulates and conceives during two separate cycles, with one fertilization occurring after intercourse with a different partner in the second cycle

questions.text: A 28-year-old male is brought to the emergency department with agitation, dilated pupils, and tachycardia. He appears restless and paranoid, and he is sweating profusely. His blood pressure is elevated. What is the likely cause of these symptoms?

Concerning the pathophysiology and toxic mechanisms of the poisoning caused by the seeds shown in the image, which of the following statements are incorrect? This causes direct irritant injury to gastrointestinal mucosa. Toxin inhibits cellular ribosomal protein synthesis. Death results primarily from cardiotoxicity. Fluid and electrolyte loss contributes to circulatory collapse.
Which of the following is the primary mechanism by which fomepizole prevents the toxic effects of ethylene glycol poisoning?

options.label: A
options.text: Fomepizole inhibits the enzyme responsible for converting glycolic acid to oxalic acid, directly preventing renal toxicity.

options.label: B
options.text: Fomepizole Non competitively inhibits alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH), preventing the formation of toxic metabolites like glycolic acid and oxalic acid.

options.label: C
options.text: Fomepizole has Higher affinity for alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH)

questions.correct_answer: C. Fomepizole has Higher affinity for alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH)
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Fomepizole has Higher affinity for alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH)

questions.text: A 10-year-old child is brought to hospital with severe abdominal pain, vomiting, and bloody diarrhea after accidentally ingesting seeds that resemble those shown in the image. Which toxin is responsible for his symptoms, and what is its mechanism of action?

options.label: A
options.text: Abrin, an RNA N-glycosidase that inhibits protein synthesis.

options.label: B
options.text: Ricin, a DNA polymerase inhibitor that disrupts cellular replication.

options.label: C
options.text: Cyanide, inhibits cytochrome c oxidase in the electron transport chain.

options.label: D
options.text: Solanine, disrupts acetylcholinesterase leading to cholinergic excess.

questions.correct_answer: A. Abrin, an RNA N-glycosidase that inhibits protein synthesis.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Abrin, an RNA N-glycosidase that inhibits protein synthesis.

questions.text: A 40-year-old male from a rural community in Central India presents to the clinic with a 6-month history of progressive stiffness and spasticity in his lower limbs. He reports no loss of sensation, changes in cognition, or bladder dysfunction. Dietary history reveals a significant consumption of a local legume, as a staple. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 21-year-old woman with a history of opioid abuse is admitted to a rehabilitation center. She reports experiencing excessive yawning, muscle aches, anxiety, sweating, and nausea whenever she attempts to quit heroin. Which of the following best describes the expected pupillary finding in this patient?
Which site is considered the best for collecting blood samples for toxicology analysis during an autopsy?
In cyanide poisoning, the characteristic cherry red discoloration of the skin is best explained by:

options.label: A
options.text: Accumulation of oxygenated hemoglobin as cells are not able to use oxygen

options.label: B
options.text: Increased carboxyhemoglobin due to carbon monoxide production.

options.label: C
options.text: Cyanide binding to hemoglobin, enhancing oxygen affinity.

options.label: D
options.text: Formation of a cyanide-cytochrome c oxidase complex with a cherry red color.

questions.correct_answer: A. Accumulation of oxygenated hemoglobin as cells are not able to use oxygen
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Accumulation of oxygenated hemoglobin as cells are not able to use oxygen.

questions.text: A medical examiner is called to a crime scene where a body has been found. The examiner notices a distinctive smell of burnt rope at the scene. Based on this clue, what is the most likely cause of the poisoning?
The below fruit belongs to which poisonous plant:
